science.author: Lesley Evans Ogden
science.title: Someone is wrecking the ozone layer again. They must be stopped
science.description: For the health of our planet, and ourselves, we must find and foil those who breach crucial environmental treaties, says Lesley Evans Ogden

science.author: John Wenz
science.title: Frankenstein planets may form from the wreckage of dead worlds
science.description: When stars die, they can explode and destroy any planets nearby. But new worlds could arise out of the debris and some could reach the mass of 10 Earths

science.author: Colin Barras
science.title: Harsh: Europe’s cannabis died just as the first farmers arrived
science.description: Cannabis – the source of the drug marijuana – virtually disappeared from Europe just as farmers arrived, so they didn’t get the chance to grow it for another 4500 years

science.author: Niall Firth
science.title: Drones plus AI help to spot sick trees and plants in time
science.description: Drones fitted with multispectral cameras are scanning forests for beetle attack, and orchards and vineyards for signs of disease before it’s too late

science.author: Helen Thomson
science.title: Aha! What happens in your brain when you have a lightbulb moment
science.description: We now know what happens in your brain when inspiration strikes. The insight may lead to new brain stimulation techniques that put you in problem-solving mode

science.author: Jessica Hamzelou
science.title: The US isn’t fertile enough to sustain itself without immigrants
science.description: For every 1000 women in the US, only around 1760 children are born, meaning the US population cannot replace itself without immigration

science.author: Michael Le Page
science.title: Lizards keep evolving toxic green blood and we don’t know why
science.description: All the green-blooded lizards in the world live in New Guinea, but it turns out the trait has evolved there independently at least four times

science.author: Debora MacKenzie
science.title: Trump’s Iran U-turn could restart the global nuclear arms race
science.description: The US has demonstrated that it cannot be trusted to stick to its word on arms control deals. The result may be a return to the dark days of growing nuclear arsenals

science.author: Lara Williams
science.title: Keep the facts front and centre in Ireland’s abortion debate
science.description: Research can offer plenty of evidence to back the case for relaxing Ireland’s near total abortion ban in the country’s upcoming referendum, says Lara Williams

science.author: Leah Crane
science.title: Some of the universe’s first stars have actually been seen
science.description: Using four of the world’s most powerful telescopes, we’ve spotted stars from just 250 million years after the big bang in a galaxy billions of light years away

nature.author: Alexandra Genova
nature.title: Along These Shifting Borders, Life is Full of Unease and Adversity
nature.description: For people near the borders of these Russian-supported separatist territories in Georgia, uncertainty is a constant struggle.

nature.title: Experience an Air Safari Through Kenya
nature.description: This safari both indulges and educates its guests.

nature.title: Discover Moscow's Colorful Cathedrals and Striking Palaces
nature.description: These iconic sites occupy the heart of the Russian nation.

nature.author: Elaina Zachos
nature.title: This Is the Age When Puppies Are the Cutest, According to Science
nature.description: Puppies reach “peak cuteness” between six and eight weeks old, which could provide some insight into how dogs evolved alongside people.

nature.author: Elaina Zachos
nature.title: Can People Really Mistake a Bear for a Dog, as This Family Claims?
nature.description: Obvious differences set wild animals apart from domesticated ones, but mix-ups happen more often than you might think.

nature.author: Amy Rankin
nature.title: A Tarantula Sheds Its Skin in New Time-Lapse Video
nature.description: This venomous, but docile, Mexican red-kneed tarantula can be seen molting over seven hours in just 40 seconds.

nature.author: Nina Strochlic
nature.title: This Is What Daily Life in North Korea Looks Like
nature.description: In a country where behavior is tightly controlled, a photographer captures individuality on the streets and in the businesses of Pyongyang.

nature.title: Vintage Photos of Royalty Around the World
nature.description: As Britain prepares for its next royal wedding, take a look at these images of royalty from the National Geographic archives.

nature.description: Despite taking hundreds of trips to Japan's iconic mountain, this photographer has never climbed it.

nature.description: Here are all the ways the Hawaiian eruption won't cause problems, according to experts.

tech.description: The Washington Post reported just yesterday that Apple was talking with Virginia officials for a new campus in Northern Virginia. But WRAL is now reporting that Apple is about to announce a new campus in North Carolina. According to WRAL’s sources, it’s “a do…

tech.description: Two weeks after Bluesmart called it quits, another smart luggage maker is pulling the plug. New York-based travel startup Raden posted a note (spotted by The Verge) on its site announcing that the company is “no longer in operation.” Unlike Bluesmart, which s…

tech.description: It’s been about two years since Build.io launched Contentstack, a headless content management system for the enterprise. Contentstack was always a bit of an odd product at Build.io, which mostly focuses on providing integration tools like Flow for large compa…

tech.description: No, it’s not a “regram” option. Sorry!  But today, Instagram is officially launching a new feature that will allow users to re-share someone’s Instagram post with their friends via Instagram Stories – something it confirmed was testing earlier this year. The …

tech.title: Pluralsight pops more than 30% in its public debut
tech.description: Pluralsight is having a pretty good day in its debut as a public company, with its shares popping more than 30% after its first trade following its IPO. There’ll be a little bit of debate as to whether Pluralsight might have left some money on the table in it…

tech.author: Sarah Perez

tech.author: Brian Heater

tech.description: Apple this morning announced another expansion of Everyone Can Code, bringing its Swift coding curricula to a number of US schools focused on students who are blind and deaf. The current list includes eight schools in California, New York, Florida, Illinois, …

art.description: “The problem is that Isle of Dogs falls into a long history of American art othering or dehumanizing Asians,” critic Angie Han wrote.

art.description: An elementary school teacher who allowed her students to draw on a white dress, creating a sentimental piece of art she could wear, is at ...

books.title: Children’s Books: Enchanting New Picture Books
books.description: Treats for little ones include the true story of a brave rescue dog, a bedtime tale about a rampaging bunny and a new Sandra Boynton board book.

books.title: Children’s Books: Standout New Picture Books
books.description: A wolf and a bear join forces. A boy collects words. A girl collects tales from the Dominican Republic. The latest from Daniel Salmieri, Peter Reynolds, Junot Díaz and more.

books.title: Letter: Diversity in Children’s Books
books.description: A psychologist stresses the need for early exposure.

books.author: JENNIFER HUBERT SWAN
books.title: Children’s Books: New Y.A. Books by Women of Color Rewrite Old Cultural Scripts
books.description: In books by Dhonielle Clayton, Tomi Adeyemi and others, teenagers from around the globe are inventive, romantic and above all empowered.

books.title: Children’s Books: Picture Books to Help Kids Weather Our Age of Anxiety
books.description: Bullying, scary news and the need for kindness are at the center of new books by Kerascoët, Jessica Love and others.

books.author: PARUL SEHGAL
books.title: Books of The Times: In a Raft of New Books, Motherhood From (Almost) Every Angle
books.description: Jacqueline Rose’s “Mothers,” one of many new books about the subject, is a sort of Rosetta Stone that examines the particular mix of fascination and dread that mothers engender.

books.author: LAUREN DUCA
books.title: Children’s Books: In New Books for Kids, Women’s Victories Speak Loud and Clear
books.description: On the road to equality, women’s historic achievements have often been dry footnotes in American schools. These authors are out to change that.

books.title: Children’s Books: If Graphic Novels Are Hip for Adults, Why Not Picture Books?
books.description: The latest from Sophie Blackall, David Wiesner and Jillian Tamaki show the form at its sophisticated best. They’re a treat for grown-up readers, too.

books.author: SOPHIE BLACKALL
books.title: Children’s Books: How Do You Talk to Children About Death? These Books Can Help
books.description: It may be the hardest topic of all to bring to kids, but these authors and illustrators have made beautiful, useful books about the end of life.

books.author: VICTORIA JAMIESON
books.title: Children’s Books: Great New Books for a Child Just Learning to Read
books.description: Clever, beautifully illustrated new books from Brian Selznick, Sara Varon and Bryan Collier that are easy to read — and to love.

books.author: AMY CHOZICK
books.title: How Does a Political Reporter Write a Memoir? First, Read Books. A Lot of Books.
books.description: A reporter who spent a decade covering Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaigns talks about her adjustment to book leave and finding the “foreign land where writers live.”

books.title: Newsbook: Read the Books Behind the Oscars
books.description: They’re even better than the movies.

books.title: Page 76: Inside the Season’s New Books
books.description: What happens on Page 76 in four of this season’s books, as envisioned by the artist Sam McKinniss.

books.title: Lens: The Surrealist Photos of Ralph Gibson
books.description: Ralph Gibson self-published his own photo books decades ago. Now, those books — filled with dreamlike sequences — have been released in a single volume.

books.title: Match Book: Dear Match Book: In Search of Comfort Reading
books.description: Books from throughout history to provide solace in troubling times.

books.description: Four new books discuss current threats to our political system.

books.title: The Shortlist: Surviving Europe’s Horrendous 20th Century
